intro: Lasiadenia, commonly known as the "ghost orchid," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate, often translucent leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, or purple. Lasiadenia species are epiphytic, meaning they grow on other plants without being parasitic, and they are often found in tropical and subtropical regions. They require specific environmental conditions, including high humidity and indirect light, to thrive. Due to their rarity and specific habitat requirements, many species of Lasiadenia are considered endangered or threatened.
